page.title: 08TOURISM BROCK NATURE TRAIL
page.content: ALONG THE RIVER BROCK IS A NATURE TRAIL,LOCATED ABOUT 1 MILE WEST OF BEACON FELL.ON THE BANKS OF THE RIVER YOU CAN SEE SPRUCE AND SCOTS PINES WHICH ARE ABOUT A 100 YEARS OLD.ALONG THE BANKS ARE LOTS OF DIFFERENT PLANTS AND FLOWERS SUCH AS LESSER CELANDINE,BLUEBELLS,WOOD ANEMONE,WOOD SORREL,YELLOW PIMPERNEL AND RED CAMPION.AMONG THE MANY BIRDS AND ANIMALS TO BE SEEN ARE SWALLOWS, SANDMARTINS AND SQUIRELS.THIS TRAIL WAS FUNDED BY SHELL AND IS MAINTAINED BY THE LANCASHIRE NATURALISTS TRUST AND IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR A GOOD DAY OUT.
